title: Trump follows through on tariff threat! What US prez's order says
content: Donald Trump has announced a 25% tariff on India due to its continued purchase of Russian crude oil, despite prior warnings. Trump stated India is 'fuelling the war machine' and expressed dissatisfaction with the trade relationship. India's foreign ministry has defended its position, citing national interests and accusing the US and EU of hypocrisy in their own dealings with Russia.

title: 'Direction of nation will be decided from here': What PM Modi said at Kartavya Bhawan
content: Prime Minister Modi inaugurated the first Kartavya Bhavan at Kartavya Path in Delhi, marking a significant step towards a developed India. He emphasized that the building symbolizes India's transformation and will be a hub for shaping policies for a 'Viksit Bharat'. The new complex aims to modernize administrative infrastructure, fostering collaboration among ministries and saving approximately Rs 1,500 crore annually.

title: PM Modi likely to visit China: First trip to Beijing since 2020 Galwan clash
content: Narendra Modi will visit China for the SCO Summit. This is his first visit since the Galwan clash. The visit happens amid trade issues with the United States. Donald Trump threatens higher tariffs on India. India defends its energy strategy. Ajit Doval is in Moscow for talks on strategic partnership. Discussions will include Russian oil supplies to India.

title: Trump a Bihari? Fake certificate names US prez as Samastipur local
content: A bizarre incident in Bihar's Samastipur district has emerged during the Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls, where an online application was filed claiming US President Donald Trump as a resident. The application included Trump's photo and his parents' names. Authorities rejected it and filed an FIR.

title: US Senator sends letter to Intel Board on CEO Lip-Bu Tan's 'China ties'
content: Senator Tom Cotton is questioning Intel's choice of Lip-Bu Tan as CEO, citing concerns over his ties to Chinese firms and a past criminal case involving Cadence Design during Tan's leadership. Cotton's letter to Intel's board chair seeks clarity on Tan's disclosures regarding Chinese investments, especially given Intel's role in securing the microelectronics supply chain for defense.

title: Mohammed Siraj's classy reply to Owaisi's viral 'poora khol' comment
content: India defeated England by six runs in the final Test, leveling the series. Mohammed Siraj took five wickets, earning praise from Asaduddin Owaisi. Siraj was named Player of the Match. Shubman Gill captained the team after Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's retirements. Gill also received the Player of the Series award.

title: 'India contributes more than US': RBI guv on Trump's 'dead economy' jab
content: RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra refuted Donald Trump's 'dead economy' remark, asserting India's strong economic performance and significant contribution to global growth, exceeding that of the United States. Despite concerns over potential US tariffs due to India's energy ties with Russia, Malhotra assured a stable inflation outlook, with authorities prepared to intervene if global oil prices rise to protect consumers.

title: Scooter DKS rode has Rs 18,500 in fines; owner pays Rs 1K after viral ride
content: Karnataka Deputy CM DK Shivakumar faced scrutiny after riding a scooter with ₹18,500 in unpaid traffic fines during a Hebbal flyover inspection. The JD(S) party highlighted the pending fines and questioned the legality of the half-helmets worn by Shivakumar and his companion.

title: Mira Murati refuses Meta's $1 bn offer: Mark Zuckerberg’s blunt response; launches a full-scale…
content: Meta's CEO, Mark Zuckerberg, reportedly attempted to acquire Mira Murati's startup, Thinking Machines Lab, with a $1 billion offer. After Murati declined, Zuckerberg allegedly launched a recruitment drive targeting its employees, including Andrew Tulloch, offering a potential $1.5 billion pay package.

title: EXCLUSIVE | Prasidh's coach: 'He played into England's hands initially, pulled off a 3-card trick later'
content: Prasidh Krishna's impressive comeback in the fifth Test against England, where he claimed eight wickets, played a crucial role in India's victory. After facing criticism and being dropped, Krishna refined his approach, displaying improved consistency and tactical awareness. His performance offers India confidence in his potential for Test matches, particularly in SENA countries, despite likely limited opportunities at home.

title: Will 'Paatal Lok' star Jaideep Ahlawat play cricketer Nitish Rana in his biopic?
content: Indian cricketer Nitish Rana expressed his desire for Jaideep Ahlawat to portray him in a biopic, citing their shared Jaat heritage and Ahlawat's Haryanvi speaking ability. Rana, known for his street-style fashion, revealed that he adopted his ponytail from Shah Rukh Khan.

title: Uttarakhand floods: 11 Army jawans missing; rescue ops underway
content: A cloudburst near Harsil in Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi district triggered a flash flood, leaving 11 Indian Army jawans missing. Rescue teams, including the NDRF and Army personnel, are working tirelessly in challenging conditions to locate the missing soldiers. The area is isolated due to road breaches and a collapsed bridge, complicating relief efforts.

title: Bill Gates warns Gen Z: AI will wipe out entry-level jobs, don’t rely on tech alone
content: Bill Gates warns Gen Z that AI proficiency alone won't guarantee job security. Entry-level positions are declining due to automation. Traditional roles are vanishing as companies adopt AI. Many young people are now exploring skilled trades and people-centric careers. Adaptability and emotional intelligence are becoming vital. Gen Z must reinvent themselves to secure their future.

title: Watch: School ditches 'backbencher' setup; inspired by Malayalam film
content: Govt. High School, Dongargaon in Burhanpur district, Madhya Pradesh, has pioneered a 'U-shape' seating arrangement, inspired by Kerala, to eliminate the concept of 'backbenchers.' Principal Jagdish Patil's initiative fosters dialogue, inclusivity, and leadership by positioning students face-to-face with the teacher. Following its success in Class 10, Class 9 students requested the same arrangement, drawing interest from other district schools.

title: 'Poo bani Parwati': Anaya Bangar wears mom's saree, recreates iconic Kareena Kapoor moment from K3G
content: Anaya Bangar, daughter of former Indian cricketer Sanjay Bangar, recently shared photos on Instagram dressed in a saree, referencing Kareena Kapoor's iconic 'Poo bani Parwati' look. Anaya, who underwent gender affirmation surgery, previously spoke about the “toxic masculinity” prevalent in cricket.

title: Bengali row: Mamata leads rally; attacks Centre over NRC, voter list revision
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee spearheaded a massive protest rally in Jhargram, condemning alleged attacks on Bengali-speaking migrants and accusing the BJP of orchestrating a campaign of harassment. Banerjee vowed to expose the BJP if attacks on Bengali language and people continue, asserting that Bengali identity will not be silenced.

title: 'It just arrives': The violent rhythm of Dharali's Kheer Gad; history of floods, absence of safety
content: Dharali, near Gangotri, faces recurrent floods from the Kheer Gad river, turning disaster into a seasonal norm. Villagers brace for the river's sudden surges, marking years by flood events rather than festivals. Despite past incidents causing significant damage to homes and livelihoods, no lives were lost between 2010 and 2018.

title: Top 5 entertainment news: Fans react to Priyanka Chopra's cryptic post about 'disrespect'
content: Priyanka Chopra's cryptic post about 'disrespect' ignited fan speculation. KL Rahul shared an adorable photo of his daughter, Evaarah, holding his finger, melting hearts online. Khushboo Patani, Disha's sister, threatened legal action against trolls spreading misinformation. Yuzvendra Chahal congratulated RJ Mahvash, dismissing dating rumors. Mukesh Khanna defended Shah Rukh Khan's National Award win, emphasizing his deserving dedication to cinema.

title: 'That mentality ... ': Sacked by BCCI, ex-India coach finally breaks silence on KKR return
content: Abhishek Nayar, after his departure from the Indian cricket team's coaching staff, has rejoined Kolkata Knight Riders as a mentor in the IPL. He's also taken on a mentorship role with the UP Warriorz in the WPL, aiming to cultivate a winning culture. Nayar highlighted the significant progress in women's cricket, noting the increased power and athleticism in the game.

title: ‘Phansi Ghar’ row: Atishi evicted from Delhi assembly; AAP seeks ASI survey
content: Delhi Assembly witnessed a tumultuous session as AAP MLAs, including Atishi, were marshalled out following a dispute with BJP members over the authenticity of a structure on the premises. The BJP claims the renovated site, inaugurated as a British-era execution chamber, was actually a tiffin room, accusing the AAP government of historical manipulation.

title: Magic Johnson praises Trinity Rodman for her latest achievement
content: Trinity Rodman marked her return from injury with a stunning game-winning goal for the Washington Spirit against the Portland Thorns, electrifying fans and earning praise from part-owner Magic Johnson. Despite a strained relationship with her father, Dennis Rodman, Trinity continues to excel, showcasing her talent and resilience on the field, adding to her impressive list of achievements.

title: Kerala house of horror: Over 10 burnt bones, skull, tooth found in man’s house
content: Police searched C M Sebastian's property in Alappuzha regarding Jainamma's disappearance. They found skeletal pieces, a bag, and cloth. A pond was drained, and a septic tank inspected. Ground-penetrating radar and a cadaver dog were used. Sebastian admitted knowing the missing women and having financial dealings. He hasn't revealed what happened to them. The investigation continues to find more evidence.

title: Bihar SIR row: Kharge seeks discussion in RS; writes to Deputy Chairman
content: Mallikarjun Kharge has urged the Rajya Sabha Deputy Chairman to allow a discussion on the Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls in Bihar, emphasizing its critical importance to voters, especially those from weaker sections. He referenced a past ruling affirming the House's right to discuss matters of fundamental democratic importance like electoral roll revisions.

title: 'Just a coincidence': Tendulkar on India winning without Bumrah
content: Sachin Tendulkar believes India's Test wins without Jasprit Bumrah were coincidental, emphasizing Bumrah's "exceptional" quality. Despite Mohammed Siraj's impressive performance, Bumrah remains a top performer. Tendulkar also lauded Washington Sundar's all-round contributions and defended India's decision to play on during the Manchester Test, supporting the team's spirit and dismissing concerns about England's bowlers needing rest before the final Test.

title: Watch: Karni Sena worker tries to slap Swami Maurya in Fatehpur; arrested
content: In Fatehpur, Swami Prasad Maurya faced an attack. A Karni Sena worker, disguised as a supporter, slapped him during a welcome ceremony. The attacker blended into the crowd. Police are investigating the incident and the attacker's motive. Maurya has been in the news for controversial remarks on Hinduism. His comments have sparked outrage among Hindu groups.

title: Kartavya Bhawan inaugurated; key things to know about high-tech building
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated Kartavya Bhavan, the first building under the Common Central Secretariat project, designed to consolidate government offices for improved efficiency. Key ministries, including Home Affairs and External Affairs, will relocate from Raisina Hills to this modern, energy-efficient complex. The broader Central Vista redevelopment aims to modernize government infrastructure and consolidate operations by June 2027.

title: Trump, Gretzky and Tkachuk to revive youth Presidential Fitness Test
content: Donald Trump's President's Council on Sports, Fitness, and Nutrition includes Wayne Gretzky and Matthew Tkachuk. The Council will focus on fitness in schools. It aims to restore college athletic customs and protect women's sports. Matthew Tkachuk impressed the White House during the Florida Panthers' visit. He will help shape fitness programs for kids.

title: Gabrielle union says menopause made motherhood harder, more emotional
content: Hollywood actress Gabrielle Union discussed her experience with menopause and motherhood. She spoke about the challenges she faced, including hot flashes and memory loss. Union also mentioned the impact of an autoimmune issue. She and Dwyane Wade welcomed their daughter, Kaavia, via surrogacy in 2018. Union had previously experienced miscarriages.

title: Afghanistan earthquake: Two tremors strike region within hours; no damage reported so far
content: Afghanistan was struck by a 4.4 magnitude earthquake on Wednesday at a depth of 155 kilometers, following a 4.2 magnitude quake earlier in the day. This seismic activity is part of a series of recent earthquakes in the region, including a 5.5 magnitude quake on August 2.

title: 'Another Pak diplomat quits': Army recalls 1971 war 'build-up'; highlights it in 'this day that year' post
content: The Army revisits the 1971 war with Pakistan. Newspaper clippings from 1971 show Pakistan's military buildup. They also highlight unrest in then-East Pakistan. The US backed Pakistan during the war. This reminder follows India's rejection of US criticism over energy trade with Russia. Tensions between India and Pakistan are currently high after a terror attack.

title: 'Irresponsible statements': BJP to file contempt petition against Priyanka's SC remarks
content: The BJP plans to file a contempt of court petition against Priyanka Gandhi Vadra for her remarks defending Rahul Gandhi after the Supreme Court criticized his comments during the Bharat Jodo Yatra. BJP MP Manan Kumar Mishra deemed her statements "irresponsible.

title: IITian, 26, non-smoker, gets stage 3 lung cancer: "The treatment was..."
content: After gathering the courage to tell her family. Rasika began treatment. She said, "The treatment was brutal. I lost 10 kgs. My skin broke out in painful rashes. I covered every mirror at home because I couldn’t bear to see myself. Amidst all this, there were nights I’d stay up & wonder, ‘Should I just end it here?’ But, I found slivers of strength–from the quiet corners of my being, & from my family & friends who refused to let me give up."

title: Watch: Brett Lee wins hearts by folding hands, saying 'Sat Sri Akaal' to young Sikh fan
content: Australia Champions faced a narrow one-run defeat against South Africa Champions in the World Championship of Legends semi-final, despite strong performances from Dan Christian and Peter Siddle. Post-match, Brett Lee connected with fans, sharing a wholesome moment with a young Sikh supporter. South Africa Champions ultimately won the tournament, defeating Pakistan Champions in the final.

title: Thousands of medical seats are going vacant: What’s really wrong with MBBS admissions in India?
content: Despite a 39% rise in MBBS seats in India from 2020–21 to 2024–25, over 2,800 seats remain vacant. Data tabled in the Lok Sabha reveals gaps linked to high private fees, complex counselling, and low uptake in newer colleges. While infrastructure expands, persistent underutilisation raises concerns about accessibility, affordability, and systemic inefficiencies in medical admissions.

title: Stars betray fugitive: Astrologer busted 15 years after kidnapping employers wife
content: Surat PCB apprehended Bhargav, a 39-year-old man, after 15 years on the run for abducting his employer's wife in 2010. He was previously arrested in 2008 for kidnapping his employer's son. Bhargav evaded police by shifting between Rajasthan and Delhi, recently returning to Surat where he was caught near Dabholi Crossroads.

title: 'You are great': Virat Kohli's sister pens emotional note for Siraj - READ
content: Following Mohammed Siraj's stellar performance at The Oval, Virat Kohli's sister, Bhawna Kohli Dhingra, lauded his efforts in India's victory against England. Siraj, the series' leading wicket-taker, received praise from Virat Kohli and a warm welcome upon his return to Hyderabad. His crucial nine-wicket match haul at The Oval secured a narrow win for India, drawing the series 2-2.

title: Fake cops, crypto trail: All you need to know about Rs 260cr global cyber fraud
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has launched an investigation into a Rs 260 crore global cyber fraud, conducting searches across multiple cities. Fraudsters impersonated law enforcement and tech support to extort money from victims. The illicit funds were converted into cryptocurrency, then laundered through hawala channels and individuals in the UAE.

title: Sachin breaks silence on handshake drama, asks 'Why should bowlers be kept fresh?'
content: The Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy concluded in a 2-2 draw, marked by the controversial handshake refusal by Jadeja and Sundar in the fourth Test. Sachin Tendulkar has strongly defended the Indian team's decision, emphasising the strategic advantage of tiring out England's bowlers before the crucial fifth Test. He lauded Sundar's adaptability and reiterated his full support for the team's approach.

title: If India cuts Russian crude under US pressure, will inflation rise? RBI guv responds
content: RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra downplayed fears of significant inflation from reduced Russian oil imports, citing diversified sources and potential government fiscal measures. His remarks come amid US tariff threats over India's Russian oil purchases, which India has rejected. Despite geopolitical tensions, the RBI held its repo rate steady, forecasting stable growth and controlled inflation.

title: Uttarkashi disaster: Video shows Dharali destroyed in 20 seconds; buildings crumbled like cardboard
content: Terrifying videos captured the moment a massive wave of water and debris devastated Dharali village in Uttarkashi district, flattening buildings and sweeping away people. The surge, triggered around 1:50 pm, reduced the bustling marketplace to rubble in seconds. Authorities have confirmed four deaths, but fear the toll could rise as rescue operations continue, with the Army, NDRF, and SDRF involved.

title: CBSE mandates 75% attendance for board exam eligibility: Rule effective from 2026; key details
content: The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) has mandated 75% minimum attendance for Class 10 and 12 students in the 2025–26 session to qualify for the 2026 board exams. Strict exemptions, surprise inspections, and zero tolerance for manipulated records underscore the board’s renewed push to curb dummy candidates and enforce academic discipline across affiliated schools.

title: Harry Brook disagrees with Gautam Gambhir: 'Didn’t score as many runs ...'
content: Harry Brook, despite being named Player of the Series by Gautam Gambhir, believed Joe Root was more deserving due to his consistent performance throughout the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy series. Brook acknowledged Root's higher run tally and overall impact, highlighting his teammate's enduring class. The series concluded in a 2-2 draw, showcasing a thrilling battle between England and India.

title: Trump was asked about India’s claim on US importing Russian uranium, fertilisers; his response
content: Amidst criticism over India's Russian oil purchases, US President Donald Trump claimed ignorance about the US importing fertilizers and chemicals from Russia. He accused India of profiting from reselling Russian oil and threatened tariff hikes, prompting a strong rebuttal from India, which cited strategic necessity and questioned the hypocrisy of Western nations continuing their trade with Russia.

title: NSDL IPO listing: Company shares list 15% higher than issue price of Rs 800
content: NSDL shares debuted strongly on Wednesday, listing at a 15% premium over the issue price of Rs 800, reaching Rs 920 and a market valuation of Rs 18,249 crore. The Rs 4,011 crore IPO was oversubscribed 41 times.

title: 'Don't burn him out': Ex-India pacer sounds alarm, says Siraj is in Bumrah's league
content: Following Mohammed Siraj's impressive performance in England, RP Singh cautioned against overworking him, emphasising the need for careful workload management akin to Jasprit Bumrah to prevent potential burnout. Singh highlighted Siraj's indispensable role and partnership with Bumrah, advocating for strategic team selections and like-for-like injury substitutions to maintain team balance and player well-being.

title: Need an ace to win big? Here's why the Mets won't overpay for one
content: Whether it's in free agency or at the trade deadline, David Stearns isn't compromising on his starting pitching philosophy.

title: Can loading up on relievers at the deadline win you a World Series? We found out
content: Contenders went all-in for relievers at this year's deadline. Here's how much bullpens really help in October.

title: ESPN acquiring NFL Network, RedZone from NFL
content: ESPN is acquiring the NFL Network and other NFL media assets, including the linear rights to the league's popular RedZone channel, in a deal that will see the NFL get a 10% equity stake in the all-sports network, it was announced.

title: Sex toy tossed on Sparks' court, lands near player
content: A sex toy landed near Indiana's Sophie Cunningham after it was thrown from the stands in Los Angeles while the Fever played the Sparks on Tuesday night, the latest such incident to interrupt a WNBA game in the past seven days.

title: Gurriel makes history with HR off 103.9 mph pitch
content: Arizona outfielder Lourdes Gurriel Jr. crushed a 103.9 mph fastball from San Diego's Mason Miller into the left-field seats for a two-run homer in the eighth inning Tuesday night, the hardest-hit pitch for a homer since MLB started pitch tracking in 2008.

title: ESPN joins with WWE; to stream WrestleMania
content: WrestleMania will be part of ESPN's new direct-to-consumer streaming service, starting in 2026, thanks to an agreement between WWE and ESPN.

title: Svitolina faces abuse after loss, blames bettors
content: Ukrainian tennis player Elina Svitolina spoke out about the deluge of hateful abuse she received online from frustrated gamblers after she lost a match in Canada, including messages wishing her death and celebrating Russia killing her compatriots.

title: 49ers TE Kittle bemoans NFL's smelling salts ban
content: The NFL is banning the use of smelling salts and ammonia packets before and during all games, a ruling that has upset 49ers TE George Kittle.

title: Jerry confident Parsons available for opener? 'No'
content: Cowboys owner and GM Jerry Jones is not confident Pro Bowl edge rusher Micah Parsons will be available for the Sept. 4 season opener against the Eagles. "No, absolutely not," Jones said Tuesday. "A big part of that is his decision. How would I know that?"

title: 📸 Bulls bring back Jordan-era pinstripe uniform
content: Jordan and the Bulls first wore the threads during the 1995-96 campaign when the team went 72-10 and won a championship.

title: Lakers' next era: Fits around Luka, LeBron's future, and why 2027 could change everything
content: The Lakers locked in Luka Doncic. Now what? NBA insiders examine the moves L.A. can and should make to build its next title team.

title: Garrett Nussmeier's final season at LSU is a family affair
content: The quarterback's dad is the offensive coordinator for the Saints. His mom is from Louisiana. Now, he has a shot to leave his stamp on the state.

title: 'Steal reps' and 'losing ground': How the Browns are navigating a four-way QB competition
content: Amid an unusual preseason with four QBs vying for the top spot, Cleveland has distributed reps in unique ways.

title: 20 sophomore NFL defenders who could stand out this season -- and what makes each player so special
content: Let's take a closer look at 20 intriguing second-year defensive players, including Quinyon Mitchell, Cooper DeJean, Jared Verse and Edgerrin Cooper.

title: How Damian Lillard's return to Portland began 18 months ago
content: After two seasons in Milwaukee, Damian Lillard returns to Portland with a torn Achilles and confidence in his future.

title: Transgender athlete debate rolls on six months after executive order
content: Six months after President Trump signed an executive order banning trans women from women's sports, these athletes are still trying to find ways to compete, and battles around their participation continue.

title: Power Rankings: Dream climb while Lynx, Liberty contend with injuries
content: Atlanta rides a three-game winning streak up the board while Minnesota and New York navigate without stars.

title: NFL draft prospects with the most at stake this season: Who can make a statement in 2025?
content: Which players' draft stocks have the most riding on the 2025 college football season? We picked out 10, including three quarterbacks.

title: 2025 SEC football preview: Power Rankings, top players, must-see games
content: Our college football experts breakdown preseason SEC Power Rankings, plus games and players to watch this fall.

title: Clippers' Harden surprised with court reveal, design on China tour
content: A basketball court with a larger-than-life image of James Harden was revealed in Guangzhou, China, on Monday.

title: Ian Darke's Premier League preview: Chelsea to contend? Will Man United rebound?
content: Ian Darke goes team-by-team to set up the 2025-26 Premier League season. Which clubs have improved this summer, and who could be in danger of relegation?

title: LaLiga's top 2025-26 kits: Barcelona, Real Madrid, Atlético, more
content: The season starts next week (stream every match live on ESPN+), so let's take a look at what teams are wearing.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Milan monitor Højlund as Sesko deal edges closer
content: Manchester United striker Rasmus Højlund looks set to leave the club as an €85m move for RB Leipzig's Benjamin Sesko edges closer. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Top 'Drumbeat' players: Bo Nix, Omarion Hampton among those generating buzz
content: Six potential league-winning players who are generating serious excitement in fantasy circles as the season draws closer.

title: Grading 50-plus NBA deals, including Chris Boucher to the Celtics
content: Kevin Pelton breaks down the most impactful signings, including the Clippers bringing back Chris Paul.

title: Did Prograis, Duarte, Canizales do enough to enter the rankings?
content: The junior welterweight and junior flyweight division were in action this weekend. Here are the latest ESPN divisional rankings.

title: Waiver wire: Look to Shepard, Carleton while Collier is out
content: Minnesota's Jessica Shepard and Bridget Carleton are worth adding from the waiver wire following the injury to Lynx star Napheesa Collier.

title: EA Sports reveals top 10 QBs in Madden NFL 26
content: From Josh Allen and Lamar Jackson to Jayden Daniels, here are the top 10 quarterbacks in Madden NFL 26

title: Collector, SP call for strict enforcement of child protection measures in Chittoor district
content: Sumit Kumar highlights the need for intensified sensitisation drives at all vulnerable areas to spread the message of ‘Beti Bachao Beti Padhao’

title: K-RIDE to finally get full-time MD after gap of nearly three years
content: The position of full-time MD at K-RIDE has remained vacant since 2021. Since then, various IAS officers have been handling the post as an additional responsibility

title: SC orders end of ‘inhuman’ hand-pulled rickshaws in Maharashtra's Matheran
content: The top court referred to a 45-year-old judgement in the "Azad Rickshaw Pullers Union v. State of Punjab" case which held cycle-rickshaws were inconsistent with the preamble’s pledge of social justice

title: NTCA highlights salary delays, staff shortage in its probe into M.M. Hills tiger deaths
content: Though the NTCA has not attributed the death of tigers to these issues, it has mentioned that inadequate allotment of funds and delay in their release as one of the weaknesses plaguing MM Hills reserve

title: Regional IFFK to kick off in Kozhikode on August 8
content: The much-awaited four-day event will conclude on August 11 with screenings at Kairali, Sree, and Coronation cinemas

title: Thadou tribe leaders, Meitei groups meet to pursue peace in Manipur
content: This was the first time that members of the tribe stepped into the Meitei-dominated Imphal Valley after the ethnic conflict began in May 2023

title: Jagan should own up responsibility for liquor scam in Andhra Pradesh, says TDP leader Anam Venkataramana Reddy
content: How can the former Chief Minister feign ignorance in spite of having close links with the main accused in the case, he questions; the YSRCP dispensation sold substandard liquor and barred digital payments at liquor outlets, he alleges

title: Closure of Jan Aushadi Kendras: Karnataka’s Health Minister justifies move, says it is to ensure free medicines
content: Gundu Rao urged Nadda to direct PMBI to supply medicines to Karnataka’s Health Department at the same rates offered to Jan Aushadi Kendras

title: Crisis looms for KTU with finance committee meeting adjourned due to lack of quorum
content: The meeting, called by V-C in-charge M. Sivaprasad, was crucial for the passage of the budget. The university’s financial transactions have been disrupted, leading to a near-complete standstill of its daily operations

title: Karnataka High Court stays proceedings against Minister K.J. George and two bureaucrats on complaint of illegalities in smart meter tender process
content: The High Court of Karnataka on Wednesday stayed the proceedings before a special court against Energy Minister K.J. George and two officials on a private complaint lodged by BJP leaders alleging a series of illegalities and corruption in awarding tender in favour of a private company to supply smart electricity meters at an exorbitant price

title: Slew of initiatives for ST department’s  golden jubilee celebrations
content: As part of the initiatives, ‘En Ooru’ tribal village project will be scaled up as a full-fledged ethnic tourism initiative, utilising all possibilities of Responsible Tourism and thus preserving tribal culture

title: Provide best medical services to those visiting PHCs: Nandyal Collector
content: People visit government hospitals with a belief that quality medical care would be available, says Rajakumari Ganiya, asking staff to meet their expectations

title: Two aerospace corridors have been proposed in State, says Industries Minister
content: We met the Defence Minister for the purpose and he has promised to take a suitable decision, according to M.B. Patil

title: Kerala ranked 19th in NITI Aayog’s India Electric Mobility Index
content: With an overall score of 36 out of a possible 100, Kerala has been adjudged ‘Aspirant’ State in the rankings which assess performance on three core themes: progress of transport electrification, readiness of charging infrastructure, and status of research and innovation in electric vehicles

title: Auto driver arrested on the charge of killing woman in Belagavi
content: The 42-year-old victim, who was an acquaintance of the accused, is said to have delayed repaying a loan to him

title: 2-Year-Old Dies As Teen Driver Runs Him Over In Madhya Pradesh
content: A tragic incident in Madhya Pradesh's Ratlam has sparked both sorrow and outrage, as CCTV footage surfaced showing a two-year-old boy, Rishik Tiwari, being crushed to death by a car allegedly driven by a 16-year-old minor.

title: Rain Data Doesn't Support Claim Cloudburst Caused Uttarkashi Disaster: Experts
content: A cloudburst in the upper catchment of the Kheer Ganga river is widely believed to have triggered the flash flood in Uttarkashi's Dharali, but experts feel the amount of rain the Uttarkashi district received on Tuesday was not enough.

title: Preacher Arrested For Raping 5-Year-Old Girl Inside Karnataka Mosque In 2023
content: A preacher has been arrested for allegedly raping a 5-year-old girl inside a mosque in Karnataka's Belagavi district in October 2023.

title: Violence Erupts After Tribal Woman Allegedly Sexually Assaulted In Bus In Tripura
content: A mob vandalised multiple vehicles and several people were injured after a tribal woman was allegedly sexually assaulted in a government bus in Bishramganj in Sepahijala district of Tripura on Tuesday.

title: Trump Suggests Vance 'Most Likely' Republican Pick For 2028
content: US President Donald Trump suggested on Tuesday that Vice President JD Vance is "most likely" to secure the Republican party nomination for president in 2028.

title: Akasa Air Examiner Suspended For Lapse In Checking Pilot Skills
content: Akasa Air's examiner has been suspended by the civil aviation regulator DGCA over procedural lapses during pilot skill test.

title: Top Court Asks Poll Body To Come Clean On Data Of Voters Deleted From Bihar List
content: The Supreme Court on Wednesday directed the Election Commission (EC) to file a reply within three days (by August 9) to a petition seeking disclosure of details of 65 lakh voters whose names were excluded from the draft electoral rolls in Bihar.

title: After Trump's 35% Tariff Slap, Canada PM Says "We'll Speak When It Makes Sense"
content: Days after the United States slapped Canada with 35 per cent tariffs, raising it from the previous 25 per cent, Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney on Tuesday said that he will speak with US President Donald Trump "when it makes sense".

title: Kinnaur Kailash Yatra Suspended Due To Heavy Rains, 617 Roads Closed
content: The Kinnaur Kailash Yatra was suspended and 413 stranded devotees were rescued after heavy rain damaged the pilgrimage route in Himachal Pradesh, officials said on Wednesday.

title: Another Odisha Woman Dies By Suicide, Father Alleges Boyfriend's Blackmail
content: A 20-year-old final-year undergraduate student was found dead after sustaining severe burn injuries inside her home in Odisha's Kendrapara district on Wednesday morning.

title: On Camera, Narrow Escape For 3 On Bike In Haridwar Landslide Scare
content: A sudden landslide sent debris crashing down a hillside, narrowly missing three young men riding a motorcycle in Haridwar on Tuesday.

title: US Tariffs To Have Minimal Effect On India's GDP, Exports: Study
content: The 25 per cent tariffs on Indian goods announced by US President Donald Trump will have "negligible" impact on the country's GDP as only USD 8.1 billion of exports to America might get affected, according to a PHDCCI study released on Wednesday.

title: Old vs New Development: Expert Explains What Led To Uttarkashi Destruction
content: The mudslide in Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi district, which razed a village and buried scores of people, may not have been triggered by a cloudburst caused by heavy rain.

title: PM Modi To Visit China, His First Since Galwan Clash, For SCO Summit
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will visit China to attend the regional summit SCO (Shanghai Cooperation Organisation) in Tianjin city from August 31 to September 1 - signalling another step towards normalising ties between the two nations.

title: 9 Years After Slapping A Cop, Maharashtra Man Gets 1-Day Jail Sentence
content: After nine years, the sessions court here convicted a 52-year-old man for assaulting a traffic police constable in a road rage incident and handed him a token one-day simple imprisonment given his fragile health and family responsibilities.

title: In Pics: France Fights Biggest Wildfire Of The Year, Burns Through 27,000 Acres
content: A wildfire in southern France which started on Tuesday injured nine people and burned through 12,000 hectares (27,000 acres) of vegetation after slowing down into Wednesday, according to local officials.

title: Railways Install Cameras In Over 11,000 Coaches For Passenger Safety: Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw
content: Indian Railways has so far fitted 11,535 coaches across zones with CCTV cameras to improve the safety and security of passengers, the Parliament was informed on Wednesday.

title: Top Court Orders Probe Into Illegal Construction At Odisha's Satkosia Tiger Reserve
content: The Supreme Court on Wednesday issued notices to the Union government, the Central Empowered Committee (CEC), among others, for construction and tourism projects within and around Odisha's Satkosia Tiger Reserve violating environmental norms.

title: US Envoy Steve Witkoff Meets Putin In Moscow As Trump's Ukraine Ceasefire Deadline Looms
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin met US envoy Steve Witkoff in Moscow on Wednesday, the Kremlin said, two days ahead of a deadline imposed by US President Donald Trump on Moscow to halt its Ukraine offensive or face fresh sanctions.

title: How Labubu Dolls Are Blowing Up Hopes Of A Plastic Ban Amid Global Talks
content: The world's governments are meeting this week to hammer out a treaty to reverse the rising tide of plastics. Oil companies have other ideas.

title: Use VVPATs in Maharashtra local body polls or go back to ballot papers: Congress’s Wadettiwar
content: Congress leader Vijay Wadettiwar said that if the use of VVPAT machines is not feasible, rural and urban civic bodies elections should be held using ballot papers

title: Karnataka Cabinet likely to approve Nagamohan Das report on August 7
content: The State Cabinet, which is expected to meet on Thursday, is likely to approve the recommendations of the commission headed by H.N. Nagamohan Das, which submitted its report on internal reservation for 101 Scheduled Castes in Karnataka to the government on Monday

title: Watch: Why did Adoor Gopalakrishnan criticise Kerala’s SC/ST and women film funding?
content: A video analysing the comments by the celebrated filmmaker, which has sparked a wave of criticism, formal complaints, and heated debate

title: Address concerns of Virginia tobacco, oil palm farmers, Eluru MP urges Centre
content: Putta Mahesh Kumar urges Union Minister Piyush Goyal to lift ceiling on sale of tobacco to clear additional stocks held by farmers and maintain crude palm oil price at ₹1.25 lakh per tonne

title: Odisha govt mandates use of Odia on signboards at shops
content: The directive said that all shops and commercial establishments across the urban areas must ensure that the Odia script occupies at least 60% of the total area of their signboards

title: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Naidu pats Minister Parthasarathy for his role in AI startup bagging laurels
content: Parabola9 AI, established at IIIT in Nuzvid with the support of the Housing Minister a year ago, wins two national awards in the Hackathon conducted recently

title: Ex-U.P. Minister Swami Prasad Maurya slapped in gathering near Rae Bareli; Karni Sena accused
content: According to police, an individual slapped him from behind while pretending to be waiting to garland him

title: Youth empowerment remains at the core of Dravidian model government, says T.N. CM Stalin
content: Mr. Stalin said through initiatives like Naan Mudhalvan, Tamil Pudhalvan, and Pudhumai Penn, the State government has been focusing on upskilling students and youngsters

title: Kerala govt. sets aside ₹1.02 crore for improving amenities at Ramakkalmedu tourism site
content: Ticket counter, toilet block, canteen, solar lighting and landscaping are among the facilities planned. Project will be executed by the Department of Tourism within eight months

title: Armstrong murder: Madras High Court quashes detention of 17 accused under Goondas Act
content: Justices M.S. Ramesh and V. Lakshminarayanan wonder how the Commissioner of Police could have scrutinised 14,000 pages of documents in a single day

title: Kannur airport to host North Malabar Travel Bazaar in November
content: Over 100 tourism-related businesses, including hotels, resorts, homestays, houseboats, Ayurvedic institutions, travel agencies, hospital and destination management companies, will showcase their services

title: Uttarkashi flood: Rescuers retrieve one body in Dharali
content: Landslips blocked arterial roads leading up to Dharali, where dozens of people were trapped and many homes and cars swept away by the raging waters on August 6, 2025; 11 Army personnel from the nearby camp in Harsil were among those missing

title: Six students injured as school bus ploughs into fields in A.P.’s Eluru district
content: The accident occurred when the steering rod of the bus got damaged and the driver lost control over the vehicle near Chigurukota village in Eluru district.

title: First Operation Kumki in A.P. successful: Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan
content: The next such drive against elephants destroying crops and endangering human lives will be organised in the Punganur forest, says Pawan Kalyan.

title: Buggana slams govt over ‘misleading claims’ on GST revenue growth
content: The YSRCP leader  also criticised the TDP coalition government for adopting flawed and ineffective fiscal policies, which led to a drastic fall in GST collections in 2024.

title: Actor Shwetha Menon booked over alleged obscene content in films
content: FIR states she performed roles in movies having vulgar and obscene content for financial gains and that the alleged content was transmitted via social media and adult sites to gain popularity

title: Rahul Gandhi claims PM Modi can’t stand up to Trump despite ‘repeated threats’ due to U.S. probe into Adani
content: Rahul Gandhi’s comment came a day after President Trump had threatened to raise the tariffs on New Delhi “very substantially” over the next 24 hours

title: One worker killed, 4 injured as platform collapses at NTPC plant in Bilaspur
content: As per the preliminary information, the victims were working on the`air pre heater platform' when the structure collapsed, the police official said

title: Lok Sabha passes Merchant Shipping Bill
content: As soon as the Bill was passed, the House proceedings were adjourned for the day amid noisy protests by Opposition members.

title: Railway passengers with e-ticket can avail travel insurance at 45 paisa only, says Vaishnaw
content: Any passenger who wishes to avail insurance benefit can opt for this scheme at the time of booking the ticket at his/her own discretion, says Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw

title: Parliament passes The Carriage of Goods by Sea Bill 2025
content: Moving the Bill, Minister of State for the Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Waterways Shantanu Thakur said the Bill intends to replace the 100 years old, pre-independence Indian Carriage of Goods by Sea Act, 1925

title: Maoist killed in encounter in Chhattisgarh’s Bijapur
content: So far, the body of a Maoist with a weapon has been recovered from the site, says Inspector General of Police (Bastar Range) Sundarraj P

title: Discussion on special electoral roll revision not permitted in Lok Sabha, says Kiren Rijiju
content: Parliamentary Affairs Minister cites rules, says issue is sub judice; House passes Merchant Shipping Bill amid Opposition protests

title: Terror funding case: Unable to represent constituency due to court rider, Engineer Rashid tells HC
content: During the hearing, the Bench remarked that when custody parole is granted, it is ordinarily at the cost of the person

title: Haryana Human Rights Commission demands report on a newborn’s severed arm during delivery
content: The Haryana Human Rights Commission says it “undermines faith in public institutions” and violates UNCRC

title: Kerala High Court halts toll collection at Paliyekkara for four weeks over NH traffic chaos
content: HC slams National Highways Authority of India for failing to resolve persistent traffic snarls along Mannuthy-Edappally stretch

title: Fadnavis meets Vantara team, says it will join Govt's plea in SC to bring back elephant Madhuri
content: Vantara has said it did not initiate or request the relocation of the elephant from the monastery in Kolhapur to its facility in Jamnagar but served only as the “court-appointed recipient facility"

title: Kerala rains: IMD downgrades red alert to orange for Kannur, Kasaragod as rainfall weakens
content: Yellow alert for Malappuram, Kozhikode, and Wayanad districts on Wednesday where isolated heavy rain is likely

title: VCK, CPI(M), CPI leaders meet T.N. CM Stalin, seek law against caste killings
content: In their joint representation, they said recurring incidents of violence against inter-caste and inter-faith couples in Tamil Nadu highlight the immediate need to enact a special legislation criminalising caste killings

title: Rain holiday prevents potential accident as school ceiling collapses in Kerala
content: Ceiling, located above the Thrissur school’s assembly area, gave way and crashed down, damaging fans and chairs placed beneath

title: Elon Musk versus Narendra Modi: Inside the battle over India's internet censorship
content: Since 2023, India has ramped up efforts to police the internet by allowing many more officials to file takedown orders and to submit them directly to tech firms through a government website

title: Aadhaar face authentication boosts ‘transparency’ of competitive exams: IT Ministry
content: Aadhaar facial recognition authentication will “build trust among aspirants and strengthen administrative accountability,” the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology told Parliament.

title: ‘Ungaludan Stalin’ initiative: Supreme Court dismisses plea against nomenclature; slaps ₹10 lakh cost on AIADMK MP petitioner C.Ve. Shanmugam
content: The Bench set aside a Madras High Court order imposing “sweeping restrictions” on the Tamil Nadu Government from naming State welfare schemes after “any living personality”

title: Man found dead in Sub-Inspector’s room at Coimbatore police station; police claim suicide
content: The incident sparked allegations of custodial death; however, Coimbatore City Police Commissioner A. Saravana Sundar claimed it was a case of death by suicide

title: INDIA bloc parties united, want discussion on SIR issue in Parliament: Kharge
content: Kharge claimed that minorities, Dalits and adivasis are facing the risk of losing their voting rights.

title: TASMAC money laundering case: Madras High Court fines ED for not filing counter affidavits to Akash Baskaran’s petitions
content: Justices M.S. Ramesh and V. Lakshminarayanan imposes the costs at the rate of ₹10,000 for each of the three writ petitions to which counter affidavits were not filed

title: Heavy rain, landslides cut off over 600 roads in Himachal Pradesh; schools closed in four districts
content: The State Emergency Operation Centre said 617 roads, including four national highways, were cut off; Kinnaur Kailash Yatra suspended

title: Game-changer virus developed by Kerala Forest Research Institute can help save teak plantations
content: HpNPV, identified and mass-developed by KFRI, offers eco-friendly alternative to chemical pesticides and prevents massive defoliation in teak

title: Maoist with ₹15 lakh bounty killed in gunfight with security forces in Jharkhand, say police
content: Bounty-carrying PLFI commander Martin Kerketta was killed in a gunfight with security forces in Jharkhand’s Gumla district;  search operation ongoing

title: Supreme Court stays trial court proceedings against YouTuber Elvish Yadav in snake venom case
content: The chargesheet alleges consumption of snake venom as a recreational drug at "rave" parties by people, including foreigners.

title: Kerala man booked for killing cat, posting video on Instagram
content: 32-year-old from Palakkad taken into custody following complaint from animal rights campaigner after disturbing video went viral

title: PM Modi inaugurates Kartavya Bhavan
content: Kartavya Bhavan-03, the first to be inaugurated, will house the Home Affairs, External Affairs, Rural Development, MSME, DoPT, Petroleum & Natural Gas Ministries, and the Principal Scientific Adviser's office

title: Medical student shot dead by father-in-law in alleged inter-caste marriage case
content: Accused opened fire at close range in front of daughter; students protest, police resort to mild lathi-charge

title: WR Allen returns to Chargers, home for 11 years
content: WR keenan Allen returns to the Chargers, home for 11 years . he spent the first 11 years of his NFL career with the chargers . the 33-year-old will reunite with quarterback Justin Herbert . we have reporters with all 32 teams, covering the ins and outs of camp .

title: Latest news, buzz from all 32 NFL training camps: Rams' Davante Adams 'outstanding' in practice vs. Cowboys
content: training camps have kicked off around the football world . the latest intel on standouts, highlights, position battles, depth chart movement, cut decisions and, of course, the quarterback room . our 32 team reporters are on the ground each day following all the action .
